comment: Dr Bandy's quizzes and exam questions are worded so obtusely that they're not effectively able to evaluate whether or not you understand the material. If you're not a good test taker, good luck on his quizzes and exam - you'll need it! Thankfully, the quizzes and exam together only account for 35% of your grade in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: This professor was the worst I've ever had. He groups students for projects, and if you're unlucky to be paired with slackers, you're stuck doing all the work yourself. He grades the whole group the same, regardless of effort. The exams were awful, the material confusing, and his grading harsh, nitpicking every tiny mistake. Avoid him if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Very difficult. His final exam sucked. We were not allowed to use the glossary, table of contents, and index. He asked trick questions on small details in the textbook. His pop quizzes were also terrible. We had to do a Harvard Business Case Review, and he graded so toughly. He roasts you at the end of your presentations. Group Work.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Worst experience in education & only B. Confusing lectures that couldn't even cover all material & became one-on-one's & no consideration of sharing with entire group. Open book exams didn't help - questions intentionally misleading & review had no clarity. Group project beat-up session to show he knows more about any subject than students.

Dr. Bandy is very knowledgeable and responds to questions/feedback within good timeframes, but some of this wording for assignments is unnecessarily confusing. He'll be more than happy to elaborate, but lots of students in the course end up confused with the exact directions some things require. Overall a very fair and lenient grader though.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is very group-heavy. 5 to 7 pop-up quizzes, final test, group project, presentation, CIO INterview, etc. The professor is very knowledgeable and easy to talk to about questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Bandy's lecture does not enhance the learning whatsoever. His lectures are more like an introduction to the chapters instead of providing any valuable insight.

He's a brilliant man but wish he could teach us more on a simpler level. I ended up with an A but not sure how much I really learned in the end - maybe some buzz words but this could have been an advantage of an MBA experience if it was taught on a comprehensible level. Boring lectures. Group work, quizzes, final comprehensive final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Class is very group-heavy. About 50% of the grade is based on group work and the group was assigned, so students had no control over the quality of their group. The professor is very knowledgeable and easy to talk to about questions, so no concerns on that front. Pop quizzes can be tough, but if you do the reading, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very intelligent professor. Thought-provoking discussions. A lot of work - group write-ups, pop quizzes (READ), detailed midterm and final (READ). If you put the work in, don't get behind, and participate in class, you will do fine. Definitely recommend if you want to learn the managerial perspective of information systems in business.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This semester, he had pop quizzes. He doesn't announce how many, or when, but you just have to be prepared with the chapter reading for that week. The quizzes are very heavy on definitions. Group projects are graded on the easy side. I wish he would dive in deeper with the topics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: It is true his exams are quite difficult. You need to attend class and pay very close attention to his lectures. Use the book and any additional materials that goes along with it. He does care and is a fair grader. If you can get passed his exams, you'll do fine in his class. Assignments and group projects weren't difficult.

Needs to learn how to have class in the time allotted. He kept us at least 30 minutes late every day, mainly because he would grill the groups on their presentations. His tests were impossible, because they covered so much material and he gave no study guide and never really lectured. Avoid taking him if at all possible.

DO NOT TAKE if you can avoid. Class nearly worthless to attend. Tests and quizzes straight from book, lectures useless. Lots of written papers, required many scholarly references. Too many papers, too much confusion in the course - esp. with group project not being well defined. Nothing was tough to comprehend - lots of time-suck busy work. AVOID !

He is knowledge about the topics. Able to engaged the class. Sometimes difficult in  conveying the materials. Expect a lot of reading & writing assignments (a lot), group assignmentspresentations, midterm and final. Keep up with your assignments and you should be fine.

I do not recommend this class. I took this class as 4 week class online. too many projects for really short time, which where very time consuming. Teacher was not helpful at all. He had really bad attitude while he answer emails.

I took IS2200 as an online summer class. That was already the beginning of a mistake. It is difficult material to learn in such a short period of time, and even more difficult online. But this professor also assigned a group project! I thought that was ridiculous for an ONLINE SUMMER class. He is also a tough grader.

I took this class my first semester back in school in 7 years. I thought he was very easy. The class is modified for summer. HE IS BIG ON CHEATING! Using a photo (even giving credit) on the project will get huge points taken off. The tests are over the book which is never used for anything else. Group project was difficult but I got a 100. Not bad

Be prepared to read many complex scholarly papers. The exams are open book, but are very hard. I did not learn a lot from this class as the goal was more cracking the code on how he grades rather than understanding the concepts. Study the textbook with the class notes he provides. Be clear and to-the-point when reviewing scholarly papers.

Worst teacher. I passed the first test with a good grade and did well on the assignments. The final was the hardest test I have ever taken. Group project was tough but not impossible. It just sucks to know that you do well all semester and bomb one test that you could fail the class.

Got a D in the class, tests suck! The 2 people who worked on the project got Ds and the 2 people who did nothing on the project passed the class, even though we talked about them not doing anything. Changes the peer grading for students the day the project was due. Yet we talked about it all semester with him and he still passed the guy he did NOTH

One thing, if you dont understand the material, and your an IS major, DROP THE CLASS with a W before you get a D. He only has 4 major Grades, Test 1, 2, Group Project, and Assigments. Other classes you have more tests and a better chance to make a better grade, like 1000 points, he has 500pts. If you wana pass, study harder then ever n maybe pass!

Professor Bandy, Though a nice guy. The class is Rediculous, grades Harsh on Group Project. We got >70%. Bad english, Must study the book and PowerP's b.c his ?'s will be either the book or powerpoints. 1st test copied the book & got a 40. 2nd test copied PP and got a 49%. So I did the opposite. Only 2 tests, so if you fail one, you fail the class.

By far the most confusing class I have ever taken. When you are looking for clarification, he speaks in generalities that only make you feel more confused than you did before. Word of advice: Start your group project as early as possible. My group's project received a poor grade despite us meeting up outside of class 3 or 4 times to work on it.

Professor fails to teach anything, just requires students to do meaningless presentations over material that is not tested.  Professor states that midterm and final will only cover concepts but reality is that questions ask for specific company names only mentioned once in book.  Strongly advise anyone to avoid this professor at any and all costs.

Professor states that exams will only cover concepts but reality is they cover specific cases from text that are not covered in class. Everyone knows that you cannot learn from a person who lies and therefore I recommend anyone to do all they can to avoid this class taught by this professor.

Took this class during the summer semester so everything was kinda jammed together.  Professor is kind of hard to understand at times but always answers questions when asked.  Tests were hard, but graded relatively fairly.

Dr. Bandy is tough, but he really is interested in his students being successful. He allows you to use unlimited notes for his exams for goodness sakes. If you cannot make a good grade on an exam under those conditions, you have bigger problems than the professor. Everyone else in my class complained about the exams, but not me.

I am genuinely amazed that unqualified people are allowed to teach these types of courses. This guy knows NOTHING but what is written on slides and in the textbook. Useless responses when inquiring about anything below the surface. I feel like I was cheated for this class. Tests and projects are FULL of busy work and obscure questions. 1/10 AVOID!

Horrible teacher! The average on the first of only two tests was a 60! The second test was just as bad. The semester project was the hardest project ever with like 15 diagrams needing to be completed. Spent hours in class going over countless number of powerpoints that had nothing to do with the poorly worded tests. Useless to go to for help!

Dr. Bandy is the worst teacher I have had at KSU. His classes are mundane, power-point fests that have no bearing on test questions. He refuses to admit any faults in his teaching and testing. If you have any other option available, take it. This guy doesn't know what he's talking about. STAY AWAY

Bandy is HORRIBLE. He can't write English at all, and has a hard time speaking it too. How you get a Ph.D with English skills like this remains a mystery. If you value your time and educational dollar take somebody else, but avoid the Indians (Dembla-Sneha-Bandy) because they are nothing more than textbook theorists with ZERO realworld experience.

Avoid this guy if you can.  The class average for the midterm was just over 60%, and he allows you to have as many notes as you want for the exam. He is difficult to understand, and when helping groups for the term project, I found that he constantly contradicted himself.  In all fairness he is a friendly guy but he sucks at teaching this cource.
Not a hard subject but a very hard class. Dose not really teach ether. 90% of the class got a 50 or bellow on the midterm. Stay away. Too much stress

I had him for IS 2060 class and it was the second worst class I've ever taken.  Attendance is optional, but he does a lot of in class group work which you can only do in class. Stay away, he thinks he knows what he's talking about but he really doesn't have a clue.  Understanding him is hard enough, just stay away, it's not worth it...

DrBandy is great. I really enjoyed his class. He was easy to talk to and very much interested in his students. I really can't recommend him enough. Few professors as interested in students as him. The material is very broad and you can supplement your brain with a 3x5 index card for the tests (You'll need it). I wish he taught more classes.

Bandy Bandy Bandy... What cant I say about this guy? He read directly from the slides... would run class over by 15 minutes but overall not so bad. He will help you anyway possible. Be careful he does call on you! but dont worry if you dont know the answer cause I never did! Got to use hand writen notes for tests. Easy A!

Dr. Bandy is the M-A-N! By far one of my favorite professors during my college experience! EXTREMELY knowledgeable about any and all subject matter. EXTREMELY interactive and will do anything to assist students. Amusing and he'll put you on the spot so always be on your toes! (Don't nod your head saying you understand unless you do. Love the guy!

Very chilled & laid back prof, understands students have lives outside the classroom & would work with you depending on your situation. Tests are a breeze if you & he records & puts lectures on WebCT incase u miss class or wanna go back for references. I paper & presentation which could be video if u cnt make it to class. Take him...u'll pass!!!

Really laid back, tries to accomodate everybody by posting recorded lectures online, so class isn't mandatory. Wants you to grasp the concept & very willing to help. Generally good prof...highly recommended!
